properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 7 at 8:00AM PST until January 9 at 11:51AM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a flood warning
for the following rivers in Washington...

Samish River At Burlington affecting Skagit County
Chehalis River At Chehalis River at Porter affecting Grays Harbor
County


The heaviest rain for now is over and only light rain is forecast
for today, but with the heavy of rain so far, the Samish River
and lower Chehalis River at Porter will go above flood stage.

The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Chehalis River At Chehalis River at Porter
* from this afternoon to Thursday morning.
* At  6:45 AM Tuesday the stage was 47.7 feet.
* Flood stage is 48.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage around 3 PM
Tuesday and crest near 49.0 feet around 4 AM Wednesday. The river
will fall below flood stage early Thursday morning.
* Impact...At 48.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Grays Harbor will flood
low pasture lands and some roads. High tidal levels at Aberdeen
will worsen flooding along the lower reaches.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
